pr_title: Add ability to disable BLS verification for fuzzing

timeline.bodyText:
I would localize this flag usage inside BLS module only.
You may alter  BLS.prepareBatchVerify and BLS.completeBatchVerify behavior based on this flag
timeline.author: Nashatyrev

replies.bodyText: Decided to skip on this as discussed offline.
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: I've localized the flag but kept the BLS.prepareBatchVerify functionality the same.
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.bodyText:
This may be too pernickety, but I'd much rather see the constant named VERIFICATION_DISABLED. This for a couple of reasons:

It's easy to lose/forget the ! at the start. It's an extra cognitive step (got to work out "not false"), and I've seen really stupid errors arise as a result of simple things like this.
The normal case is "enabled", flagging DISABLED in big letters shows more clearly that this is an exceptional path.
timeline.author: benjaminion

replies.bodyText: I think it makes a lot of sense.
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.bodyText: BTW wouldn't there be a flood of WARN logs when fuzz testing?
timeline.author: Nashatyrev

replies.bodyText: I think that's ok. We want to avoid a worst-case scenario in which somebody accidently runs without signature verification in production. Making it very noisy should help with this. I expect that fuzzers should ignore log lines, at least below ERROR level.
replies.author: benjaminion
